snippet: When members of a fledgling court system in Aleppo, Syria, refused to hand over offices to the head of a Shariah Board last month, armed fighters in vehicles promptly used force.
abstract: Various factions arrayed against Pres Bashar al-Assad in Syria are already battling to reshape country's institutions, including courts, schools, mosques and local administrations; reinventing courts is particularly onerous, with secular coalitions facing off against strong-arm tactics from Islamists who wish to institute strict Shariah law.
lead_paragraph: When members of a fledgling court system in Aleppo, Syria, refused to hand over offices to the head of a Shariah Board last month, armed fighters in vehicles promptly used force.
